snippet: The standard justifications for imprisonment become irrelevant in a prisoner’s final days or weeks.
abstract: Editorial welcomes federal judge's order to immediately release Herman Wallace, 71-year-old prisoner in Louisiana who has spent more than 40 years in solitary confinement for murder of a prison guard, because he is dying of advanced liver cancer; contends standard justifications for imprisonment, particularly in dubious cases like the one against Wallace, become irrelevant in a prisoner's final days or weeks.
lead_paragraph: The standard justifications for imprisonment become irrelevant in a prisoner’s final days or weeks.

headline.main: Mercy at the End of a Life
